summary: Have you read that TV Guide interview? Kit said that the Jon/Arya reunion won’t be all warm and fuzzy and that maybe they’re...
question: Have you read that TV Guide interview? Kit said that the Jon/Arya reunion won’t be all warm and fuzzy and that maybe they’re reunion won’t be “what we want them to be”. 😩
answer:
Yeah I have. Listen love, don’t take cast interviews to heart. They know their words play a massive role in promoting the season and creating a hype. It gets people talking, and boy, have they got tumblr and twitter in a frenzy. Almost never do these interviews give away major plot points, but simply create a ‘will they/won’t they’ debate.

But if I’m going to play the devil’s advocate here and take the interview into consideration, I can also say that I’m not worried. Yes, Arya and Jon have changed, and it might take a little time to navigate around the people they’ve become. I say this as a Jonrya shipper too.

Bear in mind, book!Arya already thinks Jon wouldn’t recognise her - but she still believes he loves her. Jon, likewise, wonders the same. But we know how much they care about each other. That’s fundamental to their relationship: that when they were unwanted by others, they found acceptance together. That’s not something that’s going to change because it’s the building blocks of what makes their bond so special.

However, Arya’s less open and Jon’s more solemn and both are traumatized af after everything they’ve been through. Both have been disillusioned and betrayed and stabbed and suffered, and when that happens, it wreaks havoc on one’s ability to connect to those around them. Kit’s got a point in that people are expecting Season 1 or AGOT Jon/Arya, the one where they’re happily teasing each other and free with their embraces. Warm and fuzzy.

But after everything they’ve been through, can we blame them if they need a little time to open themselves up again like they used to? It’s not unreasonable, and the show hasn’t really done anything for their relationship like the books have. They need the audience to see this relationship grow, to evolve and go through trials and tests to demonstrate the strength of their bond and how no matter what, they’ll support each other. It’s storytelling, after all.

It’s easy to forget that most of the GA haven’t actually read the books and don’t really know their history as well. It puts everything into perspective then. So please don’t worry! I’m fairly confident that things will turn out alright :)

summary: The next night they found shelter beneath the scorched shell of a sept, in a burned village called Sallydance. Only shards...
text:
The next night they found shelter beneath the scorched shell of a sept, in a burned village called Sallydance. Only shards remained of its windows of leaded glass, and the aged septon who greeted them said the looters had even made off with the Mother’s costly robes, the Crone’s gilded lantern, and the silver crown the Father had worn. “They hacked the Maiden’s breasts off too, though those were only wood,” he told them. “And the eyes, the eyes were jet and lapis and mother-of-pearl, they pried them out with their knives. May the Mother have mercy on them all.”
“Whose work was this?” said Lem Lemoncloak. “Mummers?”
“No,” the old man said. “Northmen, they were. Savages who worship trees. They wanted the Kingslayer, they said.”
Arya heard him, and chewed her lip. She could feel Gendry looking at her. It made her angry and ashamed.

summary: If the room with the monsters had been dark, the hall was the blackest pit in the seven hells. Calm as still water, Arya told...
body:
If the room with the monsters had been dark, the hall was the blackest pit in the seven hells. Calm as still water, Arya told herself, but even when she gave her eyes a moment to adjust, there was nothing to see but the vague grey outline of the door she had come through. She wiggled her fingers in front of her face, felt the air move, saw nothing. She was blind. A water dancer sees with all her senses, she reminded herself. She closed her eyes and steadied her breathing one two three, drank in the quiet, reached out with her hands.

I can’t believe that I kept missing this part throughout my numerous rereads. It seems like Grrm has hidden numerous foreshadowings of Arya’s future in her AGoT povs. I really find these lines to be very ironical in regards to her training in the HoBaW.

I also noticed how Arya was trying to relay to Ned all that she had learnt after eavesdropping on Varys and Ilyrio. Isn’t this exactly what Arya does in the HoBaW? Listen to gossips and relay all that she has learnt to The Kindly Man? Also look at these lines:

“You shouldn’t be following people about and spying on them in any case”

I don’t remember Arya tailing people in Braavos but we all know how Arya is learning the arts of espionage in the HoBaW.

summary: “She is balancing the woman she’s become with the girl she dreamed of being,” Williams says. Young Arya was separated from the...
body: “She is balancing the woman she’s become with the girl she dreamed of being,” Williams says. Young Arya was separated from the Starks and her goal was always to be back with her family. “Now that she is, she has something to lose,” Williams says. She’ll protect them by stepping onto the battlefield for the first time and staying on top of her kill list (those targets who have harmed her or her loved ones) - TV Guide [x]

summary:
Dany: the only place i ever felt home was at the house with a red dor and a lemon tree next to it
Sansa: Oh you lived in...
body:
Dany: the only place i ever felt home was at the house with a red dor and a lemon tree next to it

Sansa: Oh you lived in dorne?

Dany: hm, no it was braavos, many trees and a great scent

Arya: braavos is literally the most gray and piss smelling place i have ever been to, are you sure you have been there?

Dany:…

Arya:…

Sansa:… I will call bran

*meanwhile, bran has another vision*

Bran: oh, okay

Jon: what?

Bran: your parentage just turned into the cliche one

Jon:???

blog.name: sickboywolfgang
blog.title: sickboywolfgang
blog.description: Pete Bune is a screenwriter, a sketch comedy podcaster with PB&J and the Pitch It Movie Podcast, a werewolf with The Ghouligans, a former Sick Boy with Slacker TV, and one hell of a model American.

tags: she is more than just a killer
body:
My Boo Arya

I don’t get this characterization of Arya as a senseless killer. She was/is a tomboy(I can identify since am one myself) that was forced into a life on the run through no action of her own and had to do what she had to do to survive and through all of that she has killed people who wronged her,her friends and her family. Her first kill was an accident and in her eyes you could see that she was scared and surprised about it. Senseless killers don’t spare actress who they are instructed to kill,a girl who was related to the man who killed her brother and mother,a man who held her hostage and an old man she is tasked to kill. Senseless killers kill whomever they want for whatever reason and that is not ARYA STARK OF WINTERFELL. She kills people who have wronged her in some way and I don’t fault her for that. In this period of time,an eye for an eye was the best form of justice. She is loyal to her friends and family and that loyalty is what drives her to seek justice for them. I agree with her methods of avenging her loved ones. Even after all she have been through she STILL have her humanity intact as shown by her when she stops the Hound on multiple occasions from taking advantage of the small folk. As much as I love the warrior aspect of her character,their is more to her than that. She is loyal to those she loves(loves this about her)she is not an elitist,she is loving,she is ambitious,she is friendly and she actually care about people.

Now on to this mess of her not being able to have a romantic relationship or being capable of being loved because she is a senseless killer or a tomboy. Arya avenging her family and friends by killing the people who wronged them is not something that is going to be her whole life because people actually grow and change. Yes she told Ned that the Sansa path to a future was not for her and as a tomboy myself I can understand that,you want to be one of the boys,not get with the boys. But she was young and hadn’t experienced life,romance or finding that one person who might make you look at things differently. I think she got a glimmer of that when she told Gendry she could be his family. She has those romantic feelings for him(that’s what I think anyways) but she does not understand it because that was her first encounter with those feelings. I was 18 when I combined my tomboy ways with my feminine ways so it’s not too late for Arya and if that never happens to her it doesn’t mean she can’t have love and romance.

Full disclosure: I haven’t read the books so there is probably more stuff in there showing Arya’s feelings for Gendry.

In this period of time,an eye for an eye was the best form of justice. She is loyal to her friends and family and that loyalty is what drives her to seek justice for them. I agree with her methods of avenging her loved ones. Even after all she have been through she STILL have her humanity intact as shown by her when she stops the Hound on multiple occasions from taking advantage of the small folk. As much as I love the warrior aspect of her character,their is more to her than that. She is loyal to those she loves(loves this about her)she is not an elitist,she is loving,she is ambitious,she is friendly and she actually care about people.

Now on to this mess of her not being able to have a romantic relationship or being capable of being loved because she is a senseless killer or a tomboy. Arya avenging her family and friends by killing the people who wronged them is not something that is going to be her whole life because people actually grow and change. Yes she told Ned that the Sansa path to a future was not for her and as a tomboy myself I can understand that,you want to be one of the boys,not get with the boys. But she was young and hadn’t experienced life,romance or finding that one person who might make you look at things differently. I think she got a glimmer of that when she told Gendry she could be his family. She has those romantic feelings for him(that’s what I think anyways) but she does not understand it because that was her first encounter with those feelings. I was 18 when I combined my tomboy ways with my feminine ways so it’s not too late for Arya and if that never happens to her it doesn’t mean she can’t have love and romance.

Full disclosure: I haven’t read the books so there is probably more stuff in there showing Arya’s feelings for Gendry.

trail.content_raw:
My Boo Arya

I don’t get this characterization of Arya as a senseless killer. She was/is a tomboy(I can identify since am one myself) that was forced into a life on the run through no action of her own and had to do what she had to do to survive and through all of that she has killed people who wronged her,her friends and her family. Her first kill was an accident and in her eyes you could see that she was scared and surprised about it. Senseless killers don’t spare actress who they are instructed to kill,a girl who was related to the man who killed her brother and mother,a man who held her hostage and an old man she is tasked to kill. Senseless killers kill whomever they want for whatever reason and that is not ARYA STARK OF WINTERFELL. She kills people who have wronged her in some way and I don’t fault her for that. In this period of time,an eye for an eye was the best form of justice. She is loyal to her friends and family and that loyalty is what drives her to seek justice for them. I agree with her methods of avenging her loved ones. Even after all she have been through she STILL have her humanity intact as shown by her when she stops the Hound on multiple occasions from taking advantage of the small folk. As much as I love the warrior aspect of her character,their is more to her than that. She is loyal to those she loves(loves this about her)she is not an elitist,she is loving,she is ambitious,she is friendly and she actually care about people.

Now on to this mess of her not being able to have a romantic relationship or being capable of being loved because she is a senseless killer or a tomboy. Arya avenging her family and friends by killing the people who wronged them is not something that is going to be her whole life because people actually grow and change. Yes she told Ned that the Sansa path to a future was not for her and as a tomboy myself I can understand that,you want to be one of the boys,not get with the boys. But she was young and hadn’t experienced life,romance or finding that one person who might make you look at things differently. I think she got a glimmer of that when she told Gendry she could be his family. She has those romantic feelings for him(that’s what I think anyways) but she does not understand it because that was her first encounter with those feelings. I was 18 when I combined my tomboy ways with my feminine ways so it’s not too late for Arya and if that never happens to her it doesn’t mean she can’t have love and romance.

Full disclosure: I haven’t read the books so there is probably more stuff in there showing Arya’s feelings for Gendry.
trail.content:
My Boo Arya

I don’t get this characterization of Arya as a senseless killer. She was/is a tomboy(I can identify since am one myself) that was forced into a life on the run through no action of her own and had to do what she had to do to survive and through all of that she has killed people who wronged her,her friends and her family. Her first kill was an accident and in her eyes you could see that she was scared and surprised about it. Senseless killers don’t spare actress who they are instructed to kill,a girl who was related to the man who killed her brother and mother,a man who held her hostage and an old man she is tasked to kill. Now on to this mess of her not being able to have a romantic relationship or being capable of being loved because she is a senseless killer or a tomboy. But she was young and hadn’t experienced life,romance or finding that one person who might make you look at things differently. summary: The plaza was beginning to empty. The press dissolved around them as people drifted back to their lives. But Arya’s life was...
caption: The plaza was beginning to empty. The press dissolved around them as people drifted back to their lives. But Arya’s life was gone.
